result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melody L Duke

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melody L Duke in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Melody L Duke.  Attorney David T. Malone in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has completed the community service hours. Defendant needs to complete the remaining terms of the agreement in order to receive the benefit of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Melody L Duke in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Melody L Duke appeared by video means with Attorney. The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
AS TO COUNT 1:
The defendant was advised of his/her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Davis, Branch 21 for a review hearing. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement, received and filed.

Defendant Melody L Duke in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Status conference held.  Parties informed the Court this matter will resolve with a DPA.  The TAD evaluation has been completed.  Case is adjourned to Br. 37.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Melody L Duke in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Melody L Duke appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.   TAD evaluation is scheduled April 26, 2022.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (3-25-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Melody L Duke in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/23/22 @ 2:30p
